newsitem.title: MEXICO: RESEARCH ALERT - GCC raised to hold.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - GCC raised to hold.

text.p: Credit Lyonnais Securities said on Wednesday it raised its rating on Mexican company Grupo Cementos de Chihuahua to hold from sell.
The improved rating was due to the stock's 21-percent fall in the past six months, while the Mexican stock market has advanced 13 percent, analyst Rafael Diaz said in a report.
"We believe that the market has now fully discounted the higher antidumping taxes for 1997," Diaz said, referring to the rise in U.S. taxes on Mexican cement exports.
He said the possibility the tax would drop to 74.42 percent from the latest 103.85 percent would favor the company.
The brokerage estimates a 12-month price for GCC at 9.1 pesos, if the shares rise at the same pace estimated for the Mexican stock market, Diaz said.
GCC shares pared losses midday on Wednesday, trading down 12 centavos to 7.50 pesos.
